pageTitle: Statement by the Prime Minister on Korea’s Lunar New Year | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
The Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, today issued the following statement for Korea’s Lunar New Year:

“Today, Korean communities in Canada and around the world will celebrate Seollal, Korea’s Lunar New Year, and welcome the Year of the Dog.

“Seollal is one of the most important traditional Korean holidays and usually falls on the second new moon after the Winter Solstice. It is a time for friends and family to come together in a spirit of celebration, renewal, and hope for the future. During this three-day holiday, loved ones will share Korean delicacies, like tteokguk (떡국), a rice cake soup, or jeon (전), savoury pancakes made of seafood, meat, or vegetables.

“This year, Seollal has special significance for the people of South Korea, as they welcome the world during the 2018 Olympic Winter Games. In Canada, Korea’s Lunar New Year is also a chance to celebrate the many contributions of the Korean Canadian community. Korean Canadians have made our country stronger, more inclusive, and more prosperous for generations. As we move forward together in 2018, let’s continue to celebrate everything that unites us, and the diversity that makes us strong.

“On behalf of our family, Sophie and I wish happiness, health, and joy to all those celebrating Seollal.
